text: The code looks like the one used to fetch harvard_oxford. Isn't there come factoriation to do here?
Are you saying that FSL is necessary to get this data? I don't think that this is something that we can do.
title: (None, '', u'nilearn/datasets/atlas.py')

text: Is it not possible to download this atlas from Internet?
title: (None, '', u'nilearn/datasets/atlas.py')

text: I think that this is the same problem as Harvard Oxford. It is only shipped with FSL and we have to either to download the whole bundle of FSL data or host it ourselves on NITRC.
title: (None, '', u'nilearn/datasets/atlas.py')

text:
> I think that this is the same problem as Harvard Oxford. It is only
> shipped with FSL and we have to either to download the whole bundle of
> FSL data or host it ourselves on NITRC.

We solved it for Harvard Oxford by hosting the atlas.

Can we legally do that for Julish? Maybe @banilo knows?

text: Yeah, i was thinking of asking @banilo for the url. I could'nt find one. BTW, this is WIP...

I don't know whether this is related to the SPM toolbox released by Julich.
Maybe there is also some information on licensing there.

text:
Ya it's related. Saw that too. That's the SPM pluggin for exploring the
atlases. What we really need are the atlases themselves.
